org.md2k.phonesensor.phone.sensors

Class Accelerometer

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.md2k.phonesensor.phone.sensors.PhoneSensorDataSource
      • org.md2k.phonesensor.phone.sensors.Accelerometer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.hardware.SensorEventListener

    public class Accelerometer
extends PhoneSensorDataSource
implements android.hardware.SensorEventListener
    This class manages the accelerometer on the device.

    The default sampling rate for this sensor is 16 hertz.

    • Field Detail

      • frequencyOptions

        public static final java.lang.String[] frequencyOptions
        Array of sampling rates for the sensor

        • SENSOR_DELAY_NORMAL is 6 hertz
        • SENSOR_DELAY_UI is 16 hertz
        • SENSOR_DELAY_GAME is 50 hertz
        • SENSOR_DELAY_FASTEST is 100 hertz

      • GRAVITY

        public static final double GRAVITY
        Gravitational acceleration on Earth.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

        public void updateDataSource(DataSource dataSource)
        Changes the frequency field to match the frequency field in the metadata of the new source

        Parameters:

      • onSensorChanged

        public void onSensorChanged(android.hardware.SensorEvent event)
        Called when there is a new sensor event. This can be a data change or a timestamp change.

        If the time since the last data save is larger than the minimum time, the data put into an array and sent to dataKitAPI to be saved

        Specified by:
        onSensorChanged in interface android.hardware.SensorEventListener
        Parameters:
        event - event that triggered the method call

      • onAccuracyChanged

        Called when the accuracy of this sensor changes.
        Specified by:
        onAccuracyChanged in interface android.hardware.SensorEventListener
        Parameters:

        accuracy - Accuracy of the sensor reading

      • register

        public void register(DataSourceBuilder dataSourceBuilder,
                     CallBack newCallBack)
              throws DataKitException
        Calls PhoneSensorDataSource.register to register this sensor with dataKitAPI and then registers this sensor with Android's SensorManager
        Overrides:
